task.title: Custom Heading & Logo
task.shortdesc: How to add a custom heading and logo to the Better Web Help (bwh) DITA OT plugin output.

taskbody.context: The default page for the bwh output is automatically built to insert any heading it finds in the output directory. So, all you have to do is design it.

stepxmp.codeblock: Web Help

step.cmd: Once the header is created, save it as "heading.html" and put it in the root directory of the DITA OT output.

step.note: The heading.html file will only contain what's necessary for the heading (i.e. it can begin with the <div> as shown above). There is no need for <html>, <head>, or <body> tags.

step.cmd: If you have other content such as images or other files, it is recommended to have a "heading" folder into which you can put all of those. As in Step 1, in your source for your heading, make sure each reference looks into the heading folder. ()
The next time you load the page, your header should pop up on top of the web help. If it doesn't look the way you want, go back in and adjust the inline styling in heading.html.

taskbody.result: So, to add a heading to your web help system, all you have to do is include a heading.html file in the root directory of your web app and you're all set.
